titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Karl Maramorosch papers FA1446
titlestmt.author: Will Forsythe

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-01 01:50:56 -0500.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Film are open for researcb. Paper collection is currently closed to research, pending further processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various home movies from around the world, including family travels, family events, and international conferences attended by Rockefeller University's Dr. Karl Maramorosch. Additionally, collection contains a 1920s family reunion in Poland.
Titles are drawn from original film containers with some alterations based upon content viewing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Mostly arranged alphabetically by country or subject. Films also arranged chronologically if there are multiple films from the same location.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted at the discretion of RAC.
Some films are currently "Restricted." Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Family Reunion in Vienna, 1925; 1936 in Austria: Jacques, Gretel, Robert - The Horvats; Kolomyja, Poland, 1936; Cernauti and Boian, Rumania, 1936.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects include: Dr. L.O. Kunkel (Plant Pathology), Dr. F.O. Holmes (Plant Pathology), Dr. Eugene L. Opie, Dr. Armin C. Braun (Plant Pathology), Dr. Peyton Rous, Dr. Max Theiler, Dr. Richard E. Shope, Dr. P.K. Olitsky, Dr. Frank L. Horsfall Jr., Dr. Rene J. Dubos, Dr. Keith R. Porter, Dr. William Trager, Dr. D.W. Woolley (Dilworth Wayne Woolley), Dr. Lyman C. Craig (Biochemistry), Dr. Alfred E. Mirsky, Dr. Walther F. Goebel, Dr. T.M. Rivers (Thomas Milton Rivers), Dr. Detlev W. Bronk, Dr. Edward Tatum, Dr. David Rockefeller, Dr. Paul Weiss, Dr. L.G. Longsworth, Esther Judkins, Dr. Henry G. Kunkel, Dr. George Palade, Dr. Fritz Lipmann, and unidentified female lab employee.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Originally labeled "Scarsdale - The Wedding Anniversary. Includes footage of the moon landing TV broadcast and the 1967 International and Universal Exposition (Expo 67) in Montreal, Quebec.
